intro: Fumaria carinata, commonly known as the spurred fumitory, is an annual flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces distinctive spurred petals that aid in attracting pollinators such as bees and flies. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often covered in fine hairs. Fumaria carinata is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats including meadows and woodland edges.
